info.title: Spotify
info.description:
Custom connector around the Spotify API.
Functionalities available around users, playlists, albums, tracks.

get.summary: Get the User's Currently Playing Track
get.description: Get the object currently being played on the user’s Spotify account.

put.description: Start a new context or resume current playback on the user’s active device. (Spotify PREMIUM)

get.summary: Get a List of Current User's Playlists

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first result to return.

get.description: Get a list of the playlists owned or followed by the current Spotify user.
Get a list of new album releases featured in Spotify.
Get Spotify Catalog information about albums, artists, playlists, tracks, shows or episodes that match a keyword string.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search query keywords and optional field filters and operators.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Search results include hits from all the specified item types.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first result to return.

get.description: Get a list of Spotify featured playlists.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country. If omitted, the returned items will be relevant to all countries.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639-1 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: A timestamp in ISO 8601 format: yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss. Use this parameter to specify the user’s local time to get results tailored for that specific date and time in the day.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first item to return

get.description: Get a list of categories used to tag items in Spotify.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Provide this parameter if you want to narrow the list of returned categories to those relevant to a particular country.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639-1 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first item to return

get.description: Get a single category used to tag items in Spotify.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: The Spotify category ID for the category.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country. If omitted, the returned items will be relevant to all countries.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: The desired language, consisting of a lowercase ISO 639-1 language code and an uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code, joined by an underscore.

get.description: Get a list of Spotify playlists tagged with a particular category.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: The Spotify category ID for the category.

parameters.name: country
parameters.description: Provide this parameter if you want the list of returned items to be relevant to a particular country. If omitted, the returned items will be relevant to all countries.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first item to return

post.description: Create a playlist for a Spotify user. (The playlist will be empty until you add tracks.)

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user’s Spotify user ID.

name.description: The name for the new playlist
name.title: name

public.description: If true the playlist will be public, if false it will be private.
public.title: public

collaborative.description: If true the playlist will be collaborative. Note that to create a collaborative playlist you must also set public to false.
collaborative.title: collaborative

get.description: Get a playlist owned by a Spotify user.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

put.description: Change a playlist’s name and public/private state. (The user must, of course, own the playlist.)

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

public.description: If true the playlist will be public, if false it will be private.
public.title: public

get.description: Get full details of the items of a playlist owned by a Spotify user.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

delete.description: Remove one or more items from a user’s playlist.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

uri.description: An array of objects containing Spotify URIs of the tracks or episodes to remove. For example: { "tracks": [{ "uri": "spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh" },{ "uri": "spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M" }] }. A maximum of 100 objects can be sent at once.
uri.title: uri

post.description: Add one or more items to a user’s playlist.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

items.description: A JSON array of the Spotify URIs to add. For example: {"uris": ["spotify:track:4iV5W9uYEdYUVa79Axb7Rh","spotify:track:1301WleyT98MSxVHPZCA6M", "spotify:episode:512ojhOuo1ktJprKbVcKyQ"]}

position.description: The position to insert the items, a zero-based index.
position.title: position

get.description: Get the current image associated with a specific playlist.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the track.

get.description: Get Spotify catalog information for a single track identified by its unique Spotify ID.
Get detailed profile information about the current user (including the current user’s username).
Get public profile information about a Spotify user.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user’s Spotify user ID.

get.summary: Check if Users Follow a Playlist
get.description: Check to see if one or more Spotify users are following a specified playlist.

parameters.name: playlist_id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID for the playlist.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Spotify User IDs ; the ids of the users that you want to check to see if they follow the playlist.

get.description: Get Spotify catalog information for several artists based on their Spotify IDs.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the Spotify IDs for the artists. (max 50)

get.description: Get Spotify catalog information for a single artist identified by their unique Spotify ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID of the artist.

get.description: Get Spotify catalog information about an artist’s albums.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The Spotify ID of the artist.

parameters.name: include_groups
parameters.description: Filtering the type of albums returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of album objects to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first album to return

oauth2_auth: user-read-currently-playing user-modify-playback-state user-read-playback-state playlist-modify-private playlist-modify-public playlist-read-collaborative playlist-read-private user-follow-modify user-follow-read user-library-modify user-library-read
